raw_text:
Potter director signs Warner deal
 
 Harry Potter director Alfonso Cuaron has signed a three-year deal with Hollywood studio Warner Brothers, according to Variety trade magazine.
 
 The Mexican film-maker, who directed Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban, will produce mainstream movies and smaller Spanish-language films. "We had a wonderful experience with Alfonso on Harry Potter," Warner producer Jeff Robinov told Variety. Cuaron's other films include Mexican movie Y Tu Mama Tambien.
 
 The 2001 rites-of-passage drama about two teenage boys who embark on a relationship with an older woman, brought Cuaron international attention - and box office glory.
 
 It also won him and his brother Carlos, with whom he co-wrote the screenplay, an Oscar nomination for best original screenplay. Warner will distribute Cuaron's films in several languages outside the US. "This deal will give us the opportunity to collaborate with Alfonso on movies that make the most of his artistry and vision, and continue to offer him the mainstream worldwide audiences that our studio provides so successfully," said Mr Robinov.
 
 His first film for Warner Brothers was 1995's family fantasy movie A Little Princess. Based on the novel by Frances Hodgson Burnett, A Little Princess tells the story of a young girl who is sent to live in a New York boarding school when her widowed father enlists for war. After the erotic nature of Y Tu Mama Tambien, Cuaron was a surprise choice to direct the third Harry Potter film but his dark interpretation was received well by the public and critics alike.
llama3.2:1b: Alfonso Cuaron has signed a three-year deal with Warner Brothers to produce mainstream movies and smaller Spanish-language films.
llama3.2:3b: Alfonso Cuaron signs three-year deal with Warner Brothers to produce mainstream movies and Spanish-language films, with previous credits including "Y Tu Mama Tambien" and directing the third "Harry Potter" film, "Prisoner of Azkaban".
gemma2:2b: Alfonso Cuarón has signed a three-year deal with Warner Bros. The director will produce mainstream movies and smaller Spanish-language films. He is known for directing "Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban" and "Y Tu Mama Tambien."  Warner Bros. will distribute his films globally.
qwen2.5:0.5b: The Mexican filmmaker Alfonso Cuaron has signed a three-year deal with Hollywood studio Warner Brothers for producing mainstream movies and smaller Spanish-language films. He will focus on directing Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban as well as his other projects, including Y Tu Mama Tambien. His first film for Warner Brothers was A Little Princess, which he wrote based on Frances Hodgson Burnett's novel. Cuaron's dark interpretation received critical acclaim but he chose to direct his third Harry Potter film with confidence.
qwen2.5:1.5b: Alfonso Cuaron signs three-year deal with Warner Brothers as director-producer, specializing in both mainstream Hollywood films and Spanish-language content; has directed "Harry Potter" films and "Y Tu Mama". Cuaron's previous work includes 2001 coming-of-age drama about teenage romance. The deal will enable collaboration on "movies that utilize his artistic and visionary approach." Warner Brothers will distribute his films internationally, including in several languages beyond the United States.
qwen2.5:3b: Harry Potter director Alfonso Cuaron has signed a three-year deal with Warner Brothers, according to Variety. He will produce mainstream movies and smaller Spanish-language films. His 2001 film "Y Tu Mama Tambien" brought him international attention and an Oscar nomination for best original screenplay. The new collaboration will allow Warner to distribute his films in multiple languages outside the US. Cuaron's first Warner Brothers project was "A Little Princess," based on a Frances Hodgson Burnett novel.

deepseek-r1:1.5b:
<think>
Okay, so I've got this query where the user wants me to summarize a given text concisely. They want only the summary in plain text without any explanations or formatting. Let me look at the provided text first.

The text is about Alfonso Cuaron signing a three-year deal with Warner Brothers. It mentions that he's directing Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban, which got him international attention. He also co-wrote the screenplay for that movie, winning an Oscar nomination. The deal will allow his films to be distributed internationally.

I need to capture all these key points: Cuaron's role, the three-year deal with Warner, his role in Harry Potter, directing the first film, and how he worked on Y Tu Mama Tambien which inspired him. I should make sure not to include any explanations or extra details beyond what's necessary for a concise summary.

Let me structure this:

1. Start with Alfonso Cuaron signing the deal.
2. Mention the duration of the deal (three years).
3. His role in Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban.
4. The significance of the film to him.
5. Warner's approach—producing both mainstream and smaller Spanish-language films.
6. He co-wrote the screenplay for that film, winning an Oscar.
7. Distribution plan with international audiences.

I think that covers all the important aspects without going into too much detail. Now, I'll make sure it's in plain text only and free of any markdown or formatting.
</think>

Alfonso Cuaron has signed a three-year deal with Hollywood studio Warner Brothers, directing Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban. He will produce mainstream films and smaller Spanish-language works. Cuaron co-wrote the screenplay for Y Tu Mama Tambien, winning an Oscar nomination. The deal aims to collaborate with him on international films distributed globally.
tinyllama:1.1b: Harry Potter director Alfonso Cuaron has signed a three-year deal with Warner Brothers, where he will produce mainstream movies and smaller Spanish-language films. The Mexican filmmaker, who directed the critically acclaimed Harry Potter film in 2001, was previously distributed by Sony Pictures Entertainment before leaving for Warner Brothers. This agreement extends his partnership with Warner Bros. The 2001 movie "Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban" made Cuaron a household name, and he also received an Oscar nomination for best original screenplay. This new deal allows Cuaron to work on movies that showcase his artistically and commercially successful vision.

chatgpt-4o-latest: Harry Potter director Alfonso Cuaron has signed a three-year deal with Warner Brothers to produce both mainstream and Spanish-language films. Cuaron, known for directing Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban and the acclaimed Mexican film Y Tu Mama Tambien, previously worked with Warner on A Little Princess. Warner producer Jeff Robinov praised Cuaron's artistry and vision, stating that the deal would allow them to collaborate on films for global audiences. Cuaron's dark take on the Harry Potter series was well received, and Warner will distribute his films internationally.
reference: His first film for Warner Brothers was 1995's family fantasy movie A Little Princess.Harry Potter director Alfonso Cuaron has signed a three-year deal with Hollywood studio Warner Brothers, according to Variety trade magazine.Cuaron's other films include Mexican movie Y Tu Mama Tambien.After the erotic nature of Y Tu Mama Tambien, Cuaron was a surprise choice to direct the third Harry Potter film but his dark interpretation was received well by the public and critics alike."We had a wonderful experience with Alfonso on Harry Potter," Warner producer Jeff Robinov told Variety.
